turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Dimetrodon.
turn.1: What was special about the Dimetrodon sarbaeus?
turn.2: It is one of the smallest species of "Dimetrodon" in North America and may be closely related to "D. occidentalis", another small-bodied species.
turn.3: What do you find most interesting about the article?
turn.4: " D. milleri" is known from two skeletons, one nearly complete (MCZ 1365) and another less complete but larger (MCZ 1367). " D. milleri" is the oldest known species of "Dimetrodon".
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Besides its small size, "D. milleri" differs from other species of "Dimetrodon" in that its neural spines are circular rather than figure-eight shaped in cross-section.
turn.7: What other differences did it have?
turn.8: Its vertebrae are also shorter in height relative to the rest of the skeleton than those of other "Dimetrodon" species.
turn.9: Is there anything else unique about the sarbaeus?
turn.10: The skull is tall and the snout is short relative to the temporal region.
turn.11: Is there anything else that is interesting?
